item.description:
Join us as we attempt to answer the question of whether films made in a limited amount of time can stand on their own as great works or if they are only great as works made in 48 hours.

$5 all seats

What happens when you give teams of local filmmakers exactly 48 hours to make a movie? Just about anything! During the wild, sleepless weekend of May 5th, over a thousand Boston-area filmmakers wrote, shot, edited, and scored 100 short films. From scratch. In 48 hours. Come see the best of their labors!

There will be twelve 7-minute shorts, with the awards--including Best Edited and Best Film of the Boston 48HFP--announced at the end. The judges are:

Peter Keough, Film Editor for the Boston Phoenix, Wesley Morris, Film Critic for the Boston Globe, and our own Thelma Schoonmaker, this year?s Coolidge Award winner!

Comedy, horror, adventure, romance! You'll see it all with the filmmakers themselves in attendance. The finalists will also be available for viewing on Coolidge on Demand on June 11th!

Official site: http://www.48hourfilm...

This event will be hosted by Nicole, who will be holding a meetup sign at the front of the theater when the panel is over. After the talk we'll head off to JP Licks for ice cream and discussion.
item.name: Best of the 48 Hour Film Festival
